oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Corporal Lorenzo Dow Atwood to his wife Cordelia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Corporal Lorenzo Dow Atwood, Co. D, 43rd Wisc. Infantry Regiment, USA writes to his wife Cordelia. The letter discusses transportation from Louisville, Ky to Nashville, Tenn. He discusses being quartered in a hotel built by Gen. Zollicoffer in Nashville, Tenn. He writes "Kentucky and Tenn. Are the most desolate regions I ever saw at least where the railroad passes through." Atwood was part of the Union garrison at Johnsonville, Tenn. and was involved in the Battle of Johnsonville on Nov. 4, 1864.
